author: hive.helps
body:
###### Image made with Magic Media from Canva.com ___
# Ein ruhiger Monat Nach der gro√üen Einzahlung im Mai verlief der Juni eher ruhig. Die Spende f√ºr den Juni folgt noch im Laufe der Woche. Ich warte noch auf ein paar R√ºckmeldungen. Ich werde @seunruth und ihre kranke Mutter unterst√ºtzen. Mit etwas Gl√ºck kann ich sogar eine lokale Organisation auftun, die besser helfen kann. Wir werden sehen. Was sich sonst noch rund um @hive.helps getan hat, erfahrt ihr in diesem Artikel. @hive.helps hat jetzt auch einen **curation trail**. Wenn ihr eure HP passiv f√ºr etwas gutes nutzen wollt, k√∂nnt ihr diesem folgen.
# A quiet month After the large deposit in May, June was rather quiet. The donation for June will follow later this week. I'm still waiting for some feedback. I will support @seunruth and her sick mother. With a bit of luck, I may even be able to find a local organization that can help better. We will see. You can find out what else has happened with @hive.helps in this article. @hive.helps now also has a **curation trail**. If you want to use your HP passively for something good, you can follow it.
___
# HBD Entwicklung Das Ziel von @hive.helps ist es, in den n√§chsten Jahren 15.000 HBD anzusparen, um mit den Zinsen dauerhaft Spenden zu finanzieren. Bis dieses Ziel erreicht ist, werden s√§mtliche Zinsen und Rewards im Account belassen. Die Spenden zahlt @kheldar1982 bis dahin weiterhin ohne etwas aus dem Account zu entnehmen.
# HBD development The goal of @hive.helps is to save up 15,000 HBD over the next few years in order to use the interest to permanently finance donations. Until this goal is reached, all interest and rewards will be left in the account. Until then, @kheldar1982 will continue to pay the donations without taking anything from the account.
___ |Topic|Amount| |-|-| |Balance 15.05.24|3,717 HBD| |Deposits|45 HBD| |Interests|67 HBD| |Rewards|17 HBD| |Balance 23.06.24|3,846 HBD| ___
### Top Spender Die folgende Liste zeigt alle HBD unserer gro√üz√ºgigen Spender:
### Donor Overview The following list shows all our generous HBD donators:
___ |Donor|Amount| |-|-| |@kheldar1982|3,124 HBD| |@condeas|182 HBD| |@danielhuhservice|162 HBD| |@germansailor|100 HBD| |@jedigeis|34 HBD| |@fredfettmeister|5 HBD| |@edina76|8 HBD| |@siphon|5 HBD| |@hafiz34|7 HBD| |@louis88|2 HBD| ___
Der gr√∂√üte Treiber f√ºr das Wachstum der HBD Rewards waren im Juni die Zinsen. Wie angek√ºndigt sind dies nun mehr als 60 HBD pro Monat. @condeas hat @hive.helps auch diesen Monat wieder stark unterst√ºtzt und ist damit wieder auf Platz 2 der Spender. Aber auch @hafiz34 bleibt uns treu.
The biggest driver of HBD Rewards growth in June was interest. As announced, this is now more than 60 HBD per month. @condeas has again strongly supported @hive.helps this month and is therefore again in 2nd place among donors. But @hafiz34 also remains loyal to us.
___
### Top HP Delegationen Der HBD Zuwachs durch Rewards erfolgte nicht allein durch die ver√∂ffentlichten Artikel. Ein Teil kam auch √ºber das Kuratieren ausgew√§hlter Hive Artikel. Die daf√ºr notwendigen HP erhielt @hive.helps von weiteren Unterst√ºtzern. Vielen Dank daf√ºr. Die folgende Liste zeigt die 5 gr√∂√üten HP Delegationen:
### Top HP delegations The HBD growth through rewards did not only come from the published articles. A part also came from curating selected Hive articles. @hive.helps received the necessary HP from other supporters. Many thanks for that. The following list shows the 5 largest HP delegations:
___ |Donor|Amount| |-|-| |@kheldar1982|2,505 HP| |@condeas|1,515 HP| |@kryptodenno|1,009 HP| |@blue.rabbit|501 HP| |@bechibenner|252 HP| |@vasupi|202 HP| ___
### Spenden 2024 Folgende Spenden wurden bisher in 2024 get√§tigt. Zu jeder Spende ist ein Artikel verlinkt.
### Donations 2024 The following donations were made in 2023. An article is linked to each donation.
___ |Date|Organisation|Amount| |-|-|-| |05.02.24|Zwergnase gGmbH|150 ‚Ç¨| |05.02.24|Takiong Hands Namibia - Deutschland e.V.|100 ‚Ç¨| |15.02.24|Deutsche Kinderkresbstiftung|100 ‚Ç¨| |16.03.24|Zukunft f√ºr Johannes Hablik e.V.|100 ‚Ç¨| |25.04.24|Obdachlosenhilfe des DRK Hamburg|100 ‚Ç¨| |23.05.24|Neven Subotic Stiftung - Wasserhelden|100 ‚Ç¨| ___
Wie angek√ºndigt ging die Mai Spende nach Afrika. Die Neven Subotic Stiftung baut Brunnen und versorgt vor allem Kinder und Jugendliche mit Wasser.
As announced, the May donation went to Africa. The Neven Subotic Foundation builds wells and supplies children and young people in particular with water.
___
## √úber hive.helps: @hive.helps ist ein Hive-Account der √§hnlich einer Stiftung Gelder in Form von HBD oder Hive einsammelt, um diese in HBD Savings anzulegen und aus diesen Spenden an gemeinn√ºtzige Vereine und Organisationen zu vergeben. Mehr zur Idee von @hive.helps findet ihr im Vorstellungsartikel des Accounts. Ihr k√∂nnt auch gerne auf den Discord von "Hive Learn & more" kommen. Dort in der Lobby einfach @kheldar1982 anpingen und ich gebe Euch die Rolle f√ºr @hive.helps und ihr k√∂nnt mich alles fragen, bzw. Vorschl√§ge, f√ºr Kooperationen oder auch zu unterst√ºtzende Organisationen machen.
## About hive.helps: @hive.helps is a Hive account that collects funds in the form of HBD or Hive, similar to a foundation, in order to invest them in HBD Savings and use them to make donations to charitable associations and organisations. You can find out more about the idea behind @hive.helps in the first article introducing the account. You can also join the Discord of "Hive Learn & more". Just ping @kheldar1982 in the lobby and I will give you the role for @hive.helps and you can ask me anything or make suggestions for cooperations or organizations to support.
___
## Wie k√∂nnt ihr helfen? Ihr k√∂nnt helfen, indem ihr: - @hive.helps folgt - unserem curation trail folgt - die Posts Upvoted und reblogged - selbst √ºber die Initiative schreibt - HP an @hive.helps delegiert - SPS an @hive.helps spenden - oder sogar HBD oder Hive an @hive.helps sendet. Es wird genau festgehalten, wenn HBD oder Hive gesendet werden. Sollte das Projekt wieder erwarten nicht fortgef√ºhrt, werden alle Spenden zur√ºck√ºberwiesen. Derzeit k√∂nnen leider keine Spendenbescheinigungen ausgestellt werden. Es wird gerade gepr√ºft, ab wann es sich lohnen w√ºrde eine gemeinn√ºtzige GmbH zu gr√ºnden, um eine h√∂here Verbindlichkeit und steuerliche Vorteile zu erzeugen.
## How can you help? You can help by: - following @hive.helps - follow our curation trail - upvoting and reblogging the posts - writing about the initiative yourself - delegating HP to @hive.helps - donate SPS to @hive.helps - or even sending HBD or Hive to @hive.helps. It will be recorded exactly when HBD or Hive are sent. If the project is discontinued, all donations will be returned. Unfortunately, donation receipts cannot be issued at present. We are currently examining when it would be worthwhile to establish a non-profit limited company in order to create a higher liability and tax advantages.

author: theworldaroundme
body:
https://images.ecency.com/DQmb3Cfr5St3rezMqcNM7K4FYx63khkqkw25Uras6z5Q8rW/ac900058_bb36_4d8e_8561_0ba2243fd5c9.jpg

What a beautiful Saturday yesterday! It was full of sunshine, and we visited a fete in Finstock village for a couple of hours. Fete is a traditional community event to raise money for local causes and aid charity.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmePe7bb244exZPjCZyoBsoaygfmFVPP7xjwtJyQ89SP3S/2249c850_6cea_4fdc_a47d_c888373db982.jpg


The fete was set on the school grounds, creating a cozy and welcoming atmosphere.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmd5d5gt5ALoKUPoNk2tmPEbXRKnt4QgWWGRVAPG67qNgs/1b0f2c99_4318_4600_81a9_8c39693aef2d.jpg


 An ice cream van served assorted types of creamy and smooth ice cream, perfect for a warm day.

 A few tents were set up, each offering something different.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmdRPonW1UVpNPFbciQHG6idxSP2Zv1n88saXBiTsWahib/6abc3f63_52ed_46ac_a445_53ddda4f7a35.jpg


One tent was dedicated to raffles, filled with enticing prizes. 

https://images.ecency.com/DQmccmRsyWnY9PmdoDyqkW4hTjNpud3VNRZ1UH6TQ8K8nTz/7ff51059_bdcb_4ff3_90ab_5619fafca9a8.jpg


The raffle was especially fun for me as I kept winning alcoholic drinks! 

https://images.ecency.com/DQmWaZsujh7dNp7SCHTLt5ebFUkPJqAjAFiMZTPJ3tqAAi5/76913d48_cb9e_4e1c_8270_4eb9df35649f.jpg


Another tent served delicious burgers and hotdogs.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmPmxupKU2wg8L53EUWYjmz9Tc59z7rFWR1vXTWDDQkdUq/f7ee81aa_874c_437d_b8a0_cdbb2f60bbf8.jpg


And freshly baked spuds.

https://images.ecency.com/DQma4ZWocaSChZzQbh1iEF9LctYXao9r6XpDuEgAKRuctK5/cc182bc2_e1da_46af_9bc2_33fbfd54db1b.jpg


https://images.ecency.com/DQmWszeFGKxVwp6tdAsdDM1bE2jqwzy6VQ31LpEbZLnH61U/image.png

Plenty of sweets like cotton candy to satisfy anyone with a sweet tooth. 
Handmade crafts were available for sale.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmPESpay8hFumWYMYTXbgpQnuXaTePN6qCULeKXw8tqdgx/1952c580_7b63_4dbb_8078_f587fe8ed540.jpg


There was also a bar for drinks.


https://images.ecency.com/DQmcoXPHSRVusXe7zYqKhGCmwQE156jxhBY3uzZBNySithg/891d0e7a_1a07_4025_aa7d_3c5eba8cc124.jpg


We had the option to sit on hay bales or at tables, adding to the rustic charm of the event.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmT4ufmvZ8SRhr5KB2BeEXjesfLaepwTR1KoX4ikLwq5ao/c06aa47d_0de6_4b0a_a13b_d9e1f4a5f557.jpg


Children entertained the adults with their endearing presentations and dances.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmWNzfmmWaqUH2d8hfhqat1DhZD453qFcY1WLvYZKT7EdK/3cc724bd_6dab_44c8_b07c_8ef5af733f52.jpg

A corner for face painting.

https://images.ecency.com/DQme7ogy2xJZHNkoUX9V31VpurnqV6zTSaJ9EuFFozAz3US/8b09a53b_1840_4743_94f0_6d481fc0e195.jpg


 You could drive a tractor for a pound, which was a unique and exciting experience. 

https://images.ecency.com/DQmSSxsM8avnvGvYVmG12zqZ7hLj6ygB9yH179XsBXV917m/a8501fa0_ba7e_42d2_b27d_f16f8578816b.jpg

Additionally, owls were on display, and for a ¬£3 donation, I had the chance to hold one, which was a highlight for me. They use the money to raise the owls.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmenhkWFfVArDpPnmmzJje21eodaaENFHjBvLRnpatfn4T/1d5d31c7_a186_4d10_91d5_772ee0fdf6f4.jpg

Eagle Owl on my hand. 

https://images.ecency.com/DQmYiMHxoAQzEQkqsdyNAUGRXV8s3RrX7m47dqzmEByvvro/9c8eaa43_961f_4338_9d3b_5dc85acd7178.jpg


This owl has very attractive, beautiful orange eyes!


https://images.ecency.com/DQmVuJDqyWnzkpMUC4Q33mFDX8G6b6ndBpEpHcBeZqL8TbD/73d14976_7923_4abc_ae66_f382ad9418e6.jpg


Barn Owl looks so delicate and cute.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmSYNnK514XL1mU8mwun7uthK5h1UEga9GgjxbuF9EsG5P/5b06690e_4c54_472d_9224_78651778a892.jpg

Eagle Owl, almost like a painting.

https://images.ecency.com/DQmaU4BbjXr6gbc9eswpmAvUyyDoFne5YSG3svMVN5fykNW/30a14fc6_d204_4289_bb37_8c94f7767cad.jpg

Tawny Owl is fluffy and cute, and children seem to pick to hold it.!


https://images.ecency.com/DQmdGpUiqdVanYHCWFH3PLTjBoH5NApoZUg4oueuZWxxrkR/5f6669bb_1bb6_4064_9774_4df4ed308408.jpg

https://images.ecency.com/DQmduAEAaRhEEC8SRMm8bYebEt214kLF2iEeNE5UwYgLtKK/86f10dc9_090b_4237_87e8_784ecc9bc360.jpg

Finally, we called it a day and went home, where I cooked tasty roast pork in a cast iron skillet and baked a delicious cherry pie, ending the weekend experience on a perfect note.

Wishing everyone a lovely weekend!

Mariah üíó

author: kbv.animalwelf
body:
I was just celebrating the fact that there hadn't been any drop offs at the temple in quite some time but now we have had exactly that happen. I understand that puppies can be a lot of work, especially when you end up with 4 of them at the same time but there is an easy solution to all of this to prevent the need to abandon your dog and her puppies - you can get the mother sterilized like a responsible pet owner. That's right, the owner abandoned the mum as well as the pups and I guess I can say that I kind of appreciate that so that the pups have a mother to look after them at least.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmPbnHjDsNC6nWb13AEAUfHTjCpStMrFUnzcUdrw4CGnim/image.png)
Maybe I'm just a big softy, but I just can't imagine looking at these two and deciding to toss them out of the car at a temple and just hope for the best. Thankfully, the mom is with them so we don't have to hope for a surrogate, and we are creating a little hiding place for her and hope the other dogs in the temple will kind of leave her alone. Normally dogs are pretty good at leaving well enough alone but when it comes to being territorial dogs don't really care if you are big or small, young or old. Either they accept you, or they don't.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmdyqzWuw6nFKGi7gaevSrREkHan1PX8qt5vqwEwukJ8p7/image.png)
There's just something magical about puppies. I know they can be a lot of work but that is why you control your own dog's ability to have them. It isn't cruel to sterilize your dog. They wont even know what has happened and their life will be better because of it.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmQUELXs5abmMfKnXpLVVEoomqPxf8vBwX28LkTogVWeS9/image.png)
We were alerted immediately to the presence of these new dogs at one of Krabi's smaller temples and we went out to see what the deal was. Thankfully all of the dogs including the mother are in relatively good health and Mom was very approachable which suggests to me that she is very used to interacting with humans.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmeiKgjPUU6DeoRFVi2MFnoAsWYaHuayWVcVjnNKRtEYC5/image.png)
We still gave her a bunch of treats to try to get into her good graces.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmSDvqnuRiEwX6mJgu78eRSgXQmRgVTtSVLks2PavkvoU5/image.png)
The plan now is to wait about a week and then we will bring both mom and her female pup into the veterinarian to have them sterilized, then we will continue to feed them as well. We have already put a notice out there that all of these are available for adoption as a unit, because we will not separate mothers from their pups until the young ones grow up a bit. It is better this way, trust me.
if you would like to see how you can help out or simply spread the word, please visit our website at

http://krabianimalwelfare.org

![21462758_174743779763179_4154543215066704521_n.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmXHEhXj4e6AzsbAJKsFo8csozuoq1uUcMSdFQTYifzi55/21462758_174743779763179_4154543215066704521_n.jpg)
Krabi Animal Welfare is a charity run entirely by volunteers and are a registered non-profit organization in Thailand and the U.K.. We aim to relieve the pain and suffering of dogs and cats within Krabi Province. ‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ú‡∏π‡πâ‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏∏‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏´‡∏£‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ß‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà: http://krabianimalwelfare.org

#### Hive-Reachout Community>>||The Healing Power of Love (InLeo Initiative) ![vd315q.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/hive-reachout/23xypFbYDuK71qncBL8xV2nu1MG2Lz4pqGhF6vQuq2xCLSsagK4HnxCAYoxfjTpN1ky4F.jpg) ____ ##
**WELCOME TO HIVE-REACHOUT COMMUNITY**
***A community open to advertise and promote Hive Blockchain through sharing love and support to humanity..***
____ **Do well to subscribe to our community as we put heads together to promote humanity and love..** ![5wn4VDmRceY4POFaqi.gif](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/ovey10/23ydCbjvpv4mP45XPQwEU1T6WViV8sSnAzVQ5uypviUyqkLEP5dZqmv4TUcPnd745UYXq.gif)
**[Click here to be re-directed to Hive Reachout Community](https://InLeo.io/c/hive-178437)**
____ ###
**The Healing Power of Love (InLeo Initiative)**
____ https://img.inleo.io/DQmUX2cV6WQsUnwrr3YJxQ1U273YpFfFanL729128TZiuX6/Copy%20of%20Copy%20of%20Copy%20of%20Week%2032_20240622_105709_0000.png
We are pleased to announce our recent Collab with the InLeo team to promote knowledge of Hive and the InLeo user interphase amongst our community members. We will be teaching members of the community about InLeo frontend and possibly engage them in activities that will improve their knowledge about Hive and InLeo as part of the Hive Reachout collaboration with InLeo. This week, the Hive Reachout and her community members will be sharing points and ideas on the topic
**"The Healing Power of Love".**
It is our desire to provide a conducive environment of learning to all the newbies we are onboarding, and all other newbie on Hive. The Hive Reachout and InLeo initiative will help newbies and other community members to learn more about InLeo frontend and other necessary factors about InLeo.
https://img.inleo.io/DQmUyK3kcxxQpPHJcwLgoy8f9P2gHeZHRnnnY81BdJ37Kob/IMG-20240611-WA0033.jpg ____ ###
**How To Login Your Hive Account Via InLeo Frontend**
____ InLeo is a micro-blogging space set up by @leofinance community on Hive Blockchain, where you can make threads and publish your posts. You earn both in Hive and $Leo (A native token of the community) in the process. i. Click on the cite link InLeo.io https://img.inleo.io/DQmNuJ1G1qMP2PmsEn2TjGM23RJHz6YKRacnty4uAXm8TYZ/Screenshot_20240610-150717.jpg ii. You can sign in with X (Twitter) only if you registered your hive account using your Twitter X via the InLeo frontend or You may choose to sign in through your google account if you did register using your google account. iii. The most common way of signing in for users that registered their Hive accounts via other frontends other than InLeo is through LeoAuth, Hivesigner and Hive Keychain. You may choose to sign in via LeoAuth. with your Hive username and your Hive private key (The keys assigned to you when you registered your account). iv. You can sign in with your Hive Keychain. https://img.inleo.io/DQmcB8NDYp93AM1xTyL1BAUVcB42VE8oK4QJut3qhD4HfAL/Screenshot_20240610-185637.jpg This method is best used when you have your Hive keychain app installed in your mobile device if not, vi. You can use the hive signer method to login InLeo with just your username and your private key. https://img.inleo.io/DQmdZ2DuFru8ZHNDENUUmJ1tgaVaTQW4aDhxdTcLi3S2Mph/IMG-20240610-WA0019.jpg **If you can see your profile icon like this, it means you have successfully logged into InLeo** ____ ###
**How To Publish Post/Threads Via InLeo Frontend..**
____ https://img.inleo.io/DQmfTDuHqkPs4yXG5cLkfhCEHsHhQXrngCReadgPd68iW9p/IMG-20240611-WA0021.jpg i. Click on the pencil icon on the left side of your screen indicated with an arrow and select 'create a post' Note: For those using mobile the pencil icon is by the right below your screen. https://img.inleo.io/DQmTCKXKDZSLkkMguBewNQkASDCbmoNkJ7H9C3ZkurPHpvL/IMG-20240611-WA0031.jpg ii. The "Create a Post" interphase on InLeo will appear like the one above.. The number 1 is the box to input the Title of your post while number 2 is for the body of your post or article. The green arrow is pointing at the gallery icon where you can input your desired image.. https://img.inleo.io/DQmYU71ATpMPFPU1gYE5Fea224c9sy5ysayXT7cWVfvW2oD/IMG-20240611-WA0029.jpg iii. After preparing your post and inserting your desired pictures or thumbnail, you can use the number one section (Select Community) on the image above to choose the preferred community you want to publish your post in. *since this program is for the InLeo Collab with Hive Reachout community, all post should be made into the **Hive Reachout community**.. iv. The tag box indicated as number 2 is meant to input the keywords or how you label your post. *For this initiative, we shall be using; hive-reachout, love, inleo and any other preferred tags..* *Note: Press your enter key after each tag on InLeo, so that your tags can count separately...* https://img.inleo.io/DQmPuAXuxjvLQJBB4g6kgd16D3DZnmFwRwfHEVRkeqrpBoK/IMG-20240611-WA0030.jpg v. For newbies, we advice to live the reward at 50% Hive power and 50% HBD but you can go ahead to change it if you wish. - You can allocate portion of your rewards to another account via the beneficiary side and you can as well neglect it if you want to claim all rewards of your post outcome.. - Scheduling your post means your post will not be published immediately until the desired time you will choose in the post schedule side.. If you don't want to reschedule your post for another time before publishing, neglect the post scheduling and move straight to Publish your post.. - The arrow on the image above is pointing at the publish icon, you can click on it when you are done and ready to take up your post.. ### **Rules For This Initiative** - **DON'T PLAGIARIZE!!** - Create your posts in the Hive Reachout community. - Tag two or three person to join the hive-reachout/InLeo Collab. - Use the tag #hive-reachout #love and any other tags of your choice.. - Engage in (at least) two posts in the community: - Your words count should be minimum of 500 words.. - Original pictures are "encouraged", however if you want to use pictures that are not yours, use free sites like pixabay.com, pexels.com - Cite external materials properly. - Drop your InLeo post link in the comment section below... **We will be tagging our newbies in the comment section below and should incase you find this article important to someone probably a newbie, endeavor to tag them in the comment section.. We hope to ease the work for onboarders on Hive Blockchain..** ____ ##
**YOU CAN REACH US VIA OUR SOCIAL MEDIA HANDLES**
____ We are set to reach large number of audiences in this mission via the following handles:
![FUkUE5bzkAZT3HzV5tJDiU2ik81PCd4JCyhWnRcDN8XJsVFY3UNB8DCZkTaR7u9FShbSRL9TgeKjSyg6jEUohbdFwqoRvbDF5M3eoVV338ALkLbp3Yb1NyVbn6FwDnYiU84aC9ecQPwsywChghPJ3woAHGnAeZAUyNq4.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/ovey10/23zbgTz1A24uGRLzYf64hB2moefM6sMuJKL8zvEwa2wmaZzvspydzg4rmzUjgpcfwNSqg.png) * You can connect with us on Twitter(X) via: **@Hive_Reachout On Twitter X** * You can connect us on Instagram via: **@Hive_Reachout On Instagram** * Reach us via our email address **Hivereachout@gmail.com** * Or Via Discord #### Endeavor to subscribe and give us a follow..
##
***APPRECIATION***
____ We are indeed grateful to everyone, contributing through words, encouragement and donations to push this community forward. The Hive-reachout team are saying a big thank you üôèüôè ____

author: adaezeinchrist
body:
Hello great friends in @hive reach-out community. We are gradually growing and we believe that in the next six months things would have changed in this community. 
https://img.inleo.io/DQmW3Vzr8JfhwgWkhxVUeLBPKKEttrYxcGkxXaVahj17ZGR/IMG_20221125_100906_320.jpg

For this week I think I want to do something very special. Something that has been of help to me and I feel it can help someone who might need it.

In life there are things we need to understand. I have seen things work differently from what we design and some times is because of poor planning or follow up.  Why did I say that?  I have discovered that people prefer to receive than to give. There is more blessings in given than just receiving. 


In all my life as a woman I discovered from the Holy book that a giver is sowing a seed but a receiver is eaten up the harvest. Harvest and seed for sowing which is bigger? From the eyes of man, we know that harvest is more in number than the seed to be planted most times. But for how long can the harvest last? It might just be within one or two months and we will begin to buy food from the market. Maybe also depending on the quantity of the harvest. But no matter what the quantity is, it will soon vanish from your sight. 

 https://img.inleo.io/DQmVQd2KYnhRJnGCSgjNm2CJKQrymSNvVj4JSWVtBTygWmQ/IMG_20221125_100257_900.jpg 
The seed on the other hand May just be a bad of üåΩ corn. What will be the amount of maize that will be harvested at the end? If the farmer took proper care of the farm during the farming season, then he may end up getting up to one trailer full of maize. Counting it in bags may give us up to hundred bags of maize. You see the huge difference? 

We need to learn to give than just receiving. If all we do is who will help me? How can I make see someone who will dash me this or that? We need to start thinking of who to help with our little substances that we have. Remember the widow that came to the prophet in the Holy book asking for help because her husband died and his debtors have come to carry her children away. The prophet told her to go and make use of that little oil that she have to solve all her problems and still, she will still have left over. That is exactly what happened. She was made to know that the little oil that she thought was not good for anything can really save her family and even the future. This is a great lesson for me. Give and receive not. 

When we give, we are sowing the little that we have and it will come back in hundred folds. This is the promise of God to givers. 

The more you give, the more you receive. Givers never lack and I have confirmed it in my life. Each time I give to the needed in the society, God always bring something very special that I have been expecting to me. He will not allow us beg when we have taken time to give what we have to others.

Lastly, the little that we have will still remain little if we don't share it with others in love. 

All the images used in this post belongs to me.
 

Posted Using [InLeo Alpha](https://inleo.io/@adaezeinchrist/blessed-is-the-hand-that-give-than-the-hand-that-receive-2ib)

author: kbv.animalwelf
body:
There is a butcher here in Krabi that is a dog-lover and found out about us. While he doesn't have enough money to contribute to our cause he was very kind to volunteer to give us a bunch of bones once a month. He could sell these bones to make a bit of money because people will pay a few cents for a bone in order to put it in a broth of some sort but instead he choses to give them to us for free! They are greatly appreciated by all of our furry pals that call the Tiger Cave Temple home.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmeCRC3bVahcBGc3qqhdZHVeZP2Upw6M3Qm8WSraVsFK4F/image.png)
How perfect and lucky is that photo timing? This little pup is one of the only youngins at the temple at the moment and this is a good thing. There are already over 100 dogs at the temple and the last thing we need is another round of puppies. Thankfully, all of the female dogs at the temple are sterilized and there hasn't been many midnight dropoffs of unwanted pets either. At least for now, we seem to have the pupulation under control.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmPeyCbntiSjnoaoxGzQxNrhF3emhipCGQJVN1xM985AxY/image.png)
Back to the bones and a little bit of information that someone out there might find helpful. I know these dogs at the temple quite well and they are very familiar with me and know that I mean them no harm. In fact, they really look forward to my arrival because I always come bearing food gifts of some sort. Even though that is the case I **always leave dogs alone when they are munching on a bone.** Even though these dogs know me, messing about with a dog when it is chewing on something like a bone is a fantastic way to end up getting bit.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQma3tJAfCYpkCYN5YFFomoAXiCkEdBb941wFD4ZANyf2Va/image.png)
This is why most of my pictures of dogs chewing on the bones that I just gave to them are taken from a distance. You probably know the old expression "let sleeping dogs lie" but I think "leave dogs chewing on bones alone" is an even more important one to keep in mind.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmWJFnH2XdXdxGLt5pVYJXY1yPzGk6r7JWQVHFM8NZwSaJ/image.png)
I like these dogs and they like me. They do not see me as a threat. However, almost all dogs and especially dogs that grew up in a semi-hostile environment like living the street can be extremely protective when it comes to food. When I distribute the bones these dogs that spend all day hanging out with one another will take the bone far away from the other dogs to chew away in solitude.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmQzFmC3985yjV83p3SsWj45NcW5YGmq2hvuj6vRxFD7uL/image.png)
I've always found this trait of dogs to be quite humorous and it doesn't really matter what sort of environment the dog grew up in, it is just a trait that most dogs seem to have built into their DNA. Even my 3 dogs at home, who have never had to work for a meal in their lives nor have they had food taken away from them in years outside of very rare instances, will still wander off to a corner of the yard or in my house where they are away from the others as well as me when they are working on a chewy snack.
![image.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmUqJmFfMRe5gx5gc8iYTUTL1AbpE72qGwaatuFXhuFyCo/image.png)
The doggos really enjoyed this special treat today and every time that I come with them. Some folks out there state that giving bones to dogs is a bad idea but there are a couple of reasons why these bones are ok for these guys. The bones I give them are very large and are not the kind that will splinter like chicken bones will. Also, these dogs are not a couch-sleeping Pomeranian. These dogs grew up eating whatever they could find and are very adept and not hurting themselves when eating. It's good to exercise caution with any dogs that grew up in a more contained environment though. I wouldn't give bones to my dogs at home because they didn't grow up in the wild. They just aren't as dangerous as the old wives tale would have you believe. A cursory health check was done on the 2 dozen or so dogs that greeted me at the entrance and everyone seems to be in tip-top shape and the monks reported no injuries, illness, or new additions to the pack so that my friends, is what we and Krabi Animal Welfare call a win!
if you would like to see how you can help out or simply spread the word, please visit our website at

http://krabianimalwelfare.org

![21462758_174743779763179_4154543215066704521_n.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmXHEhXj4e6AzsbAJKsFo8csozuoq1uUcMSdFQTYifzi55/21462758_174743779763179_4154543215066704521_n.jpg)
Krabi Animal Welfare is a charity run entirely by volunteers and are a registered non-profit organization in Thailand and the U.K.. We aim to relieve the pain and suffering of dogs and cats within Krabi Province. ‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ú‡∏π‡πâ‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏∏‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏´‡∏£‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ß‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà: http://krabianimalwelfare.org

author: fokusnow
body:
https://img.inleo.io/DQmQoVzPgFnf5R9dHGYRL44SjqT62XJzDuBmTtmPJ4WanuU/image.png ![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmYnQFCNp5gi9A1WW6oV1ujXhxsS6BwBTGP28btCngLGMx/image.png) ## Introduction Institutional adoption of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology continue to grow from strength to strength. Many organizations have now found that cryptocurrencies have a huge role to play in modern payment systems. The British Red Cross is another big organization that recently showed trust in crypto payments. It recently announced in [a post](https://x.com/BritishRedCross/status/1796187796954136836) on X that it now accepts crypto donations. This move by the British Red Cross is a huge one, signaling to the global human society that crypto is stepping up its quest for mass adoption. The International humanitarian crisis happening in various parts of the world would appreciate any and all forms of monetary donations. This move to include and accept crypto donations would create another channel to increase the number of users donating to help manage crisis around the world through the British Red Cross. ![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmYnQFCNp5gi9A1WW6oV1ujXhxsS6BwBTGP28btCngLGMx/image.png) ## How to Donate crypto The British Red Cross has created a dedicated web page for crypto donations. On this page, you have some important information as regards making donations in crypto. To begin, many cryptos are accepted as donations including Bitcoin, Ethereum, USDC, Bitcoin Cash, Doge coin, Shiba Inu, and many other cryptos. It is up to the donor to decide which cryptos to send. It is important to specify where the donations should be channeled - the Impact Area. Number one is the **General Fund.** If this option was chosen, the British Red Cross would use the donation to assist wherever there is the biggest need or immediate crisis. And donations that are not specific to any Impact Area are also sent to the General Fund. The next Category to donate to is the **Israel-OPT appeal**. This donations would be used to help victims of the ongoing crisis due to the war between Israel and Gaza. Here is what the Red Cross has to say about this donation for this mission: > The Israel and Occupied Palestinian Territory Appeal will support people in areas currently affected and those potentially affected in the future by the crisis. In the unlikely event that we raise more money than can be reasonably and efficiently spent, any surplus funds will be used to help us prepare for and respond to other humanitarian disasters anywhere in the world [source](https://donate-crypto.redcross.org.uk/) The **Emergencies Fund** category is used to support people that are suffering as a result of natural or man-made disasters such as the effects of war, flooding, social unrest and other emergencies. This fund is used to respond to the needs of people in emergencies that have happened right now and others that will still happen. Donors should be fully aware of each category or mission and select accordingly when making their crypto donations. In addition to choosing where their donations would be spent, it is also important to know that there is a processing fee attached to each donation. A third party is handling the crypto donations processing, hence, the processing fees. Lets talk about that. ![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmYnQFCNp5gi9A1WW6oV1ujXhxsS6BwBTGP28btCngLGMx/image.png) ## Network fees for donations Your crypto donations need to be converted to fiat which is what the Red Cross actually needs to support victims of crisis. In order to do this one, they gave partnered with Giving Block who will be responsible for accepting and processing the donations on behalf of Red Cross. Germini wallet is being used to accept the crypto donations. So the processing fee would go to Giving Block and Germini as partners to Red Cross for crypto donations. Processing fees are not charged separately. So while making crypto donations, it would be important to factor in the processing fee which would be deducted from the donation. Depending on the amount donated, the process fee would be less than 4% of the donated amount. For donations more than $1,000,000, a processing fee of 1% would be deducted. Donations of $100,000 to $1,000,000 would attract a processing fee of 1.9% of the amount. Donations between $25,000 and $100,000 would require 2.9% processing fee. 3.9% processing fee would be charged on donations less than $25,000. The British Red Cross would like to conduct some form of KYC on donations that are above ¬£5,000. So here is what would be required for anyone that wishes to donate in excess of ¬£5k. > If you‚Äôd like to donate ¬£5,000 or more, please email your name and donation amount to donatecrypto@redcross.org.uk as we must carry out ethical screening and due diligence checks before accepting your donation. We cannot accept crypto donations of ¬£5000 or more which do not pass these checks. [source](https://donate-crypto.redcross.org.uk/) ![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmYnQFCNp5gi9A1WW6oV1ujXhxsS6BwBTGP28btCngLGMx/image.png) ## Crypto is great for charitable courses If there is one sector that needs to embrace crypto fully, it would be organizations that are into charity. What the British Red Cross has done is a great example for the rest. The potentials for accepting crypto donations are simply endless. Consider the following benefits. * **Inclusive Giving:** Imagine being able to let people from all over the world support those in crisis through their financial donations. There is no other universal currency that could make it possible except cryptocurrencies. The Red Cross would now be capable of accepting donations beyond all borders without breaking a sweat. Crypto will facilitate inclusive giving as anyone could donate for a humanitarian course without any limitations. Crypto is the universal currency of the world. * **More Donations:** When more people are allowed to donate, then more funds would be received. The crypto sector is huge and ever-growing. It is also filled with users that are willing to support a noble course. All these large number of people now have the opportunity to significantly increase donated funds when they give in crypto. * **Impactful giving:** One of the best way to ensure that your donation reaches the intended victims is through crypto donations. The blockchain data is immutable. All donations are permanently recorded in a blockchain ledger and can be audited. Hence, donations are not in any danger of being diverted for uses other than what they are intended for. This is a huge problem in charitable giving. Sometimes, the recipients receive little or nothing from the donated funds because of fraudulent middlemen. Crypto would solve that. ![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmYnQFCNp5gi9A1WW6oV1ujXhxsS6BwBTGP28btCngLGMx/image.png) ## Finally If you would like to donate crypto to the British Red Cross, then why not. You can follow the link below after you have done your own research. This post is not for endorsement. * **[Donate Crypto Now](https://donate-crypto.redcross.org.uk/)** * **[Announcement on X](https://x.com/BritishRedCross/status/1796187796954136836)**

author: chidistickz
body:
Some people think it's pretty easy to show off acts of charity but the truth is that whenever you show off an act of charity, you lose something and sometimes it's a bit painful coz maybe you initially had plans but those plans where interrupted by that act of charity. Many would be asking this question " what's the compelling force behind this act of charity ", maybe those asking haven't really experienced it that's why they're asking that way, big I will tell you the reason behind every act of charity. https://img.inleo.io/DQmcDmjVtfopgxc9fAkA4epcUp7ykCk76cynXybEECmZ2jW/InShot_20240616_110622359.jpg What powers every act of charity is LOVE and COMPASSION, if indeed any act of charity isn't powered by love them it's not really charity, maybe it was done out of a selfish reason, that's called FLAUNTING not charity. Many people would love to show off what they have or what they're capable of by giving others and most times they do it obviously so others can notice. Unlike flaunting, every sincere act of charity is powered by love and compassion, this reasons are strong enough to make you give out what you have even when it's something you need. It's true what people say about love*LOVE IS BLIND ", mind you this statement isn't only for romantic love but it's applies to general love, people that think it only applies to romantic love are the selfish ones that would only give to people that will give them back. If we truly love the people we claim to love, then we would learn to appreciate them even if we it costs badly and also, love is not limited to our relatives, family and friends, it's never a crime to sincerely show a stranger love, but this must also be done with wisdom because not everybody out there is sincere, some people might intend to hurt you but if you truly are sincere then God who sees our hearts will make sure you don't get hurt. There are many people we envy because we think they are cheerful when they give in public, well I can't be a George right now but I don't really think doing it in the public is necessary though some people have good intentions and maybe didn't have the privacy so as not to do it in public but If otherwise then I'd say it's flaunting. From my little experience, I've learnt that love requires sacrifice and sacrifice sometimes hurt, the reason why it hurts is that it's mostly a need and no one is paying you back what you've lost or rather given out, this is why to love someone is also Devine, üëà this is what somany people haven't really seen that's why they fall in and out of love easily. The hardest is showing a stranger love, it's like taking a risk because you have no idea if that stranger intends to hurt you of if the stranger is sincere, this is also why to love is devine because we don't know why we love the people we love not every other persons, the people find ourselves loving are the people God have assigned to us. ![png_20230530_081043_0000.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/chidistickz/242NszRKuweyRfQ9cMFkmsz7RHg7rPH4VpR91adZKX7uWqXPNvfwgFcqgSEiFGY83HXHV.png) Designed via Canva

author: dlmmqb
body:

![Image1.png](https://images.hive.blog/500x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dlmmqb/AL35xBfs86Rms3sz6jnqLTacFsnhKWytPHHT9FHsuXs9vGX8pKBfHyJhnJgfRyN.png)
[DALL¬∑E 3](https://www.bing.com/images/create/a-poster-showing-a-bearded-24-year-old-man-buying-/1-665d8f44d5204f5b9fb678206f0ccd8f?id=RYy%2BrQD74EPRffi0k4VeaA%3D%3D&view=detailv2&idpp=genimg&noidpclose=1&thId=OIG3.P90p9JZYpkerO3WApWr_&FORM=SYDBIC&ssp=1&darkschemeovr=1&safesearch=moderate&setlang=en&cc=XL&PC=SANSAAND)

I hope you all are doing well. As you know, I often share my various habits with you all. The reason behind this is that I want my friends to adopt the practices that I find beneficial for myself. Thus, I frequently write about my activities. Most of my activities are individual efforts aimed at helping others through self-initiative. You might recall my blog on cleanliness where I emphasized starting a cleanliness drive from within oneself. Today, I wish to write about a similar activity. Perhaps you will find this practice commendable and might adopt it yourselves. If someone else begins this task inspired by me, it will be an ongoing charity for me. Nothing would make me happier than leaving behind a legacy that continues to thrive even after I am gone.

## My Habit Now, let me tell you about a habit of mine that I practice to the best of my ability and wish for all of you to adopt as well. This habit is celebrating Labor Day. You might be surprised because Labor Day is observed only on the 1st of May, so why am I calling it a habit? Your surprise is valid because a habit is something one repeatedly performs. But why I call celebrating Labor Day a habit will become clear by the end of this blog. Everyone knows that May 1st is observed worldwide to acknowledge the labor class, highlight their issues, and provide support and encouragement. Many conferences are held, various programs take place, and assistance and appreciation are extended to the laborers. However, I would like to question whether observing Labor Day just one day a year is enough? Certainly not. Laborers work every day, in the morning, evening, heat, and cold, and are always there to serve us. So why should we dedicate only one day to them? We should acknowledge them every day. Therefore, whenever I get the chance throughout the year, I celebrate Labor Day.

## My Labor Day May is the peak month of summer in Pakistan. In Karachi, where I live, it remains hot throughout the year. December, January, and February have relatively bearable weather, which we call winter. From March and April, the heat gradually intensifies, reaching its peak in May and continuing through June and July. As these days are scorching hot, imagine how difficult it must be for laborers to work in such heat. Whenever I go out during these hot days, or when I used to return from university, or any other time when I see laborers, I try to help them. As you might have gathered from my previous blog about the downsides of giving money to beggars, I am not in favor of giving cash. Instead, I prefer to provide food items or other useful goods. Because even if you give money with the intention of helping, it still feels like charity. This is my personal belief, and you may disagree.

## Celebrating Labor Day For me, any day I see a laborer is Labor Day, and I celebrate it. On May 1st specifically, and generally throughout the year, I gift various items to laborers during their work. On May 1st, I leave home and buy water, juice bottles, Jam-e-Shirin (a popular red syrup in Pakistan), fruits, biscuits, chips, sweets, and particularly items that provide relief from the heat. Then I go out to celebrate Labor Day. Whenever I see a laborer working in the scorching sun, I gift them these items. They gladly accept them. Fortunately, most laborers in our country do not beg. Once, when I tried to give food items to a vegetable seller as assistance, he refused, saying he was here to earn a respectable living and despised taking free items. Before I could explain, he sent me away, so I decided to buy vegetables from him instead. I didn't haggle over the price, paid him respectfully, and also managed to give him a gift.

## Facing Criticism Every good deed you initiate will garner both praise and criticism. Some people will mock you and try to discourage you. I mentioned in my cleanliness blog how my school and university fellows mocked me. Similarly, when I started this practice, I received many negative comments. I used to leave university around 2 PM and saw rickshaw drivers and other transport workers waiting for passengers in the sweltering afternoon. I thought of arranging cold drinks for them. So, I started bringing a bottle of Jam-e-Shirin with me in the morning, adding ice after university, and offering it to them. While many appreciated and blessed me, some gave all sorts of advice. Someone suggested setting up coolers, others questioned why I was serving drinks myself. Though I've seen coolers on Karachi's streets where thousands quench their thirst, I don't have the resources for such large-scale work. I do what I can within my means, and therefore, I continued my practice despite strange questions and unsolicited advice.
